lead_paragraph: General Electric’s announcement is a stark recognition that it has become harder for financial services businesses to make big profits in the postfinancial crisis environment.

headline.print_headline: Do-It-All Era Ending as G.E. Returns to Core
headline.main: Do-It-All Era Ending as G.E. Returns to Core

snippet: General Electric’s announcement is a stark recognition that it has become harder for financial services businesses to make big profits in the postfinancial crisis environment.
abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column maintains that General Electric's decision to sell off most of GE Capital is recognition that it has become difficult for financial services businesses to make large profits due to tighter regulations in wake of financial crisis; notes that sell-off is also indicative of company's abandonment of strategy that sought to use its management skill to dominate variety of markets.
